body:
How can I enable Self-Service Access Requests in AWS IAM Identity Center, and is this feature available by default?

To my understanding, this feature is not enabled by default. You may consider to manually configure it in the IAM Identity Center console:
Sign in to the AWS Management Console using an account with administrative permissions.
Navigate to IAM Identity Center.
In the left-hand menu, select Settings, then go to Access Requests.
Enable the Self-service access requests option.
Configure approval workflows.
Save your changes.
Once enabled, users will see a Request Access button in their AWS access portal for resources they’re not yet assigned to.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/singlesignon/latest/userguide/enable-identity-center.html

In the setting console there is no "Self-service access" option
